confession.seduction_context: After losing lawsuit with miller from Baccarat, was distressed about losses. First encountered black dog with wind outside La Chapelle, 2 weeks later approached by man in black called Jolybois who promised to help win case
sabbat_activities: talk of spoiling crops and doing harm

testimony.quarrel_subject: Payment for failing to cure sick horse
testimony.threat_quote: told servant he had not been paid

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day after threat to servant
fell ill suddenly and died a week after telling accused to remove pigs

testimony.quarrel_subject: Economic resentment - accused said in contempt 'one can see those who have money, for his part he could not build a house and had no money'

witnesses.name: Catherine femme Jean de Sainct Pierre

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: sickened next day after he touched it, died after 10 or 12 weeks

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband owed him rent for house

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: husband fell suddenly ill after encountering accused while carting wine, died within a week

testimony.threat_quote: accused said those responsible should be burned; husband replied 'he was a nigromancien and sorcier and that he and his wife should be burned'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: lost milk for rest of year

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over going to fetch wheat - they took another person instead of accused
Various quarrels, some ten years earlier
Payment for failing to cure horse

testimony.threat_quote: wished witness might have it 'au creu du ventre'

witnesses.name: Pacquat femme Adam Vaulthier marchand de Raon

testimony.quarrel_subject: Complained he had been badly paid for treating horses
Payment for treating horse with farin

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: shortly after accused asked to see horse and was told falsely it was away

timeline.subject: Jean Pierron Geliat
timeline.details: Voluntary confession given - confrontations were to continue but accused wanted to confess

timeline.subject: Jean Pierron Geliat
timeline.details: Additional interrogation, renewed earlier confessions and added more malefices

timeline.subject: Jean Pierron Geliat
timeline.details: Death sentence from Change de Nancy

notable_quotes.speaker: Witness 2 (male, 65)
notable_quotes.french: que lors qu'il faict du temps et tempest, ledict Jean est ordinairement au champ, ou par chemin, au contraire que les autres Gens revienent en ville, mesme qu'il faict estat de guarir le bestail comme un devin
notable_quotes.context: Witness describing accused's suspicious behavior during storms and his healing practice

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean de Sainct Pierre (witness 5)
notable_quotes.french: en desdain qu'on voyoit bien ceulx qui avoient de l'argent que de sa part il ne pouvoit faire cela pour bastir la sienne et qu'il n'avoit point de deniers
notable_quotes.context: Accused expressing resentment about witness's wealth while building house

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean de Sainct Pierre (witness 5)
notable_quotes.french: un chacun peut juger qu'assurement c'est de sortillege
notable_quotes.context: Witness describing his mysterious illness and paralysis

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Estienne (husband of witness 11)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il estoit ung nigromancien et ung sorcier et que luy et sa femme ilz les failloient brusler
notable_quotes.context: Husband calling accused and his wife nigromancer and witch who should be burned

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretien Brabant (witness 14)
notable_quotes.french: que comme il se mesle de guarir le bestail ca et la, il deposant luy a ouy dire qu'il prenoit des jours pour cueillir des herbes et des heures, et qu'il faict beaucoup de ceremonies a l'entour du bestail
notable_quotes.context: Describing accused's healing practices involving specific days and hours for gathering herbs and ceremonies around animals

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Gros Demenge de Vazenal (witness 20)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il scavoit bien comme les années pouvoient advenir, et quant il y auroit année de bled et de paxon
notable_quotes.context: Accused claiming to know how years would turn out and when there would be years of wheat and peace

notable_quotes.speaker: Judges
notable_quotes.french: pour se venger de ses ennemis, parce que ce n'est le propre de Satan de les laisser en repos sans faire mal
notable_quotes.context: Judges insisting devil would have given powder to revenge enemies, as it is not Satan's nature to leave people in peace without doing evil

relationships.evidence_text: Had lived at la Neufville since marriage 16 years earlier with Jehenne, veuve Colin Jalley
Zabel femme Demenge Ganaire (witness 3) and Demenge Ganaire (witness 15)

relationships.person1: Catherine femme Jean de Sainct Pierre

Pacquat femme Adam Vaulthier marchand de Raon (witness 21)
contracted with her husband to cure their sick horse but complained he had not been paid
neighbors in la Neuveville-les-Raon, accused commented on witness building house
husband owed him some rent for house
they were tithe collectors together some 15 years earlier when accused lived at Blainville

harms_catalog.harm_description: sick horse contracted to cure, after long treatment no better, subsequently died

harms_catalog.harm_description: caused to fall from a tree
bad hand, then whole body became swollen, became paralyzed and bedridden (perclus et en chartre), still in pitiable state

harms_catalog.harm_description: death of chambermaid

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell out of tree and injured himself on post of fence
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Was angry witness took his 'paulx de disme' (tithe tools), wished he might have it 'au creu du ventre'

harms_catalog.harm_description: two horses with farcin disease, one died, other had to be taken elsewhere after accused's cure failed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Heard he complained he had been badly paid

harms_catalog.harm_description: death a year earlier

harms_catalog.harm_description: horse died shortly after treatment
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Payment dispute and witness afraid to show horse to accused when he asked

killed cow
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Asked him to cart grain, then used someone else

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed cow
killed calf

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed calf

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed two calves

material_culture.context: Payment received for attempting to cure horse
Given by devil to kill animals
Given by devil to cause languishing
Accused used prayers to heal animals, knew at least 3 very good ones
Took specific days and hours for gathering herbs for healing
Offered potion to wife of Chretien Brabant for 'mal de la mere' but warned she would have no more children
Tithe collection tools that witness took from accused
Bastien Piernille was carting wine when he encountered accused
Dispute over going to fetch wheat
Jean de Sainct Pierre building house, accused expressed resentment about not having money to build
Made annual offering of a hen to master so he did not have to go to sabbat more often
All people at sabbat were masked

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, residence of accused for 16 years
Where accused lived 15 years earlier, worked as tithe collector with Idoul Bon Temps
Where Jean Forgeat lived when he heard story about Idoult falling from tree
Residence of Jean Cuguin; where accused encountered black dog outside
Location of witness Demenge Gros Demenge
Origin of miller in lawsuit with accused
Where accused was going when approached by devil Jolybois; where timber was being loaded
Accused ordinarily in fields during storms; disputes over water for fields

prior_legal_disputes.description: Lawsuit at la Neufville with miller from Baccarat, condemned to pay money miller alleged he owed him although he had already paid
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Lost case - condemned to pay, which led to distress and seduction by devil

legal_context.redress_outcome: Jean de Sainct Pierre paid fine to accused for calling him witch

hearsay_chains.content: heard story that accused caused Idoult to fall from tree when living in Nompatelize
had been told that previous Sunday accused said witness suspected him of causing death of first wife
told him accused was a witch

emotional_state_notes: claimed to be comforted in prison by figure 'comme de la lumiere' which was his 'bon ange'
admitted he had been frightened of torture
insisted he was a good man

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said he had heard that Jean Cuguin had killed horse himself in the woods
Catherine femme Jean de Saint Pierre spoke ill of others
Denied wrongdoing with Ganaire horses, said Ganaire had long wished him ill

third_parties.context: Told accused off about damage done by his animals; accused confessed to killing two of his calves

third_parties.context: Died a year earlier; accused allegedly spoke ill of her; witness then suspected him

third_parties.name: chambermaid of Demenge Ganaire
third_parties.context: Died, suspected to have been killed by accused or his wife

economic_context.details: Accused practiced animal healing for payment, multiple disputes over payment for services. Lost lawsuit with miller over alleged debt he claimed to have already paid. Expressed resentment about wealth disparity when neighbor built house. Debtor (Bastien Piernille) owed him rent. Economic precarity evident - could not afford to build house, no money. Healing practice was source of income but also source of conflicts when treatments failed and payment disputes arose.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial demonstrates typical pattern of cunning folk/healer prosecution. Accused practiced veterinary healing using herbs, prayers, and ceremonies with specific timing. Economic disputes and payment conflicts over failed treatments feature prominently. Confessed voluntarily without torture, though admitted fear of torture. Attended sabbat but claimed reluctance and made offering to reduce attendance. Named accomplices through masks excuse. Execution expenses noted as 88 francs including confessor dinner due to absence of resident curé.
